data.title: Sarah Jessica Parker Movies and Shows
data.meta_description: Learn about Sarah Jessica Parker on Apple TV. Browse shows and movies that feature Sarah Jessica Parker including Sex and the City, Hocus Pocus, and mâ¦
data.text:
Makeover

The campaign showdown begins when Brittany and Blaine go head-to-head for Student Council President. Meanwhile, Kurt gets the internship of his dreams. Musical performances include âEverybody Wants to Rule The Worldâ, âCelebrity Skinâ, âThe Way You Look Tonight/Youâre Never Fully Dressed" and âChange Would Do You Goodâ.

Thanksgiving

Itâs time for Sectionals, and New Directions receives guidance from some of the recent McKinley graduates who volunteer to mentor the glee club during their Thanksgiving breaks. Meanwhile, Rachel and Kurt have a non-traditional holiday dinner in the Big Apple. Musical performances include "Homeward Bound/ Home", "Come See About Me", "Whistle", "Live While We're Young", "Let's Have A Kiki/ Turkey Lurkey Time" and "Gangnam Style".

Lights Out

When the power goes out at McKinley High, Will and Finn enlist the members of New Directions to âunplugâ and perform acoustic numbers. Meanwhile, Isabelle Wright (guest star Parker) asks Kurt to volunteer at the Vogue.com charity event, with Rachel and Santana in tow. Musical performances include "You've Lost That Loving Feeling", "Everybody Hurts", "Little Girls", "At The Ballet", "We Will Rock You", and "Longest Time".

Jack Grows His Own Beanstalk

Jack from Jack and the Beanstalk shows up with a problem: He has a cow, but he needs a beanstalk! He knows he's supposed to trade the cow for something, but doesn't know what. Can Leela and Telly help him figure out what to do? Plus: Debi Mazar visits the street to talk about the word âhumongous.â Murray learns to play soccer and Super Grover tries to help Sarah Jessica Parker as she waits for a mysterious âBigâ on Sesame Street. Brought to you by the letter Z and the number 1.

Elmo Learns About Growing Up

Elmo is jealous of all the attention Ginaâs baby Marco gets, so he pretends to be a baby, too! How will Gina take care of two babies? Also in this episode: Sarah Jessica Parker demonstrates the word âsigh,â and Papa Bear and Baby Bear sing about bear hugs. Brought to you by the letter A and the number 16.
